page.title: 04EDUCATION in EAST HADDON
page.content: East Haddon is served by the village primary school which is Church of England Controlled. It follows the policy of the L.E.A. and admits children at 4+. Before this age the needs of the children are met by the village playgroup which meets twice weekly in the village hall. The school itself is old (the earliest classroom dating from 1790) and built out of local sandstone. There are three classes for the 64 children.The children are given a wide ranging education by the teachers.The equipment in the school is modern - much being provided by the Friends of the School who meet regularly.The school is friendly and welcoming and is devoid of the vandalism and other problems of our time. Children are given ample opportunities to pursue their musical and dramatic interests.
